meanings.definition: Injury to a plant caused by excessive exposure to sunlight.
meanings.sent1: The sunscald on the leaves was evident after days of intense sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed the sunscald on his crops after a heatwave.
meanings.sent3: The sunscald on the plant seemed like a sunburn from too much sunshine.
meanings.sent4: The sunscald on the delicate flowers was a harsh reminder of nature's power.
meanings.sent5: The sunscald on the tree leaves looked like a sun-kissed blush.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the skin is damaged by the sun's rays.
meanings.sent1: Her sunscald was painful after spending too much time at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The hiker's sunscald on his arms was a result of forgetting sunscreen.
meanings.sent3: The sunscald on his face made him resemble a ripe tomato.
meanings.sent4: The sunscald on her shoulders was a reminder to always wear a hat in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The sunscald on his nose was as red as a cherry tomato.
